input_text.Prompt:
Walmart Canada has taken down its online photo processing store following a "potential compromise of customer credit card data."

The chain said it was recently informed of the potential breach of its Photocentre website.

"We immediately launched an investigation and will be contacting customers who may be impacted," Walmart said. "At this time, we have no reason to believe that Walmart.ca, Walmart.com or in-store transactions are affected. "

The chain has immediately suspended the photo website and all mobile applications pending an investigation. The chains recommends that anyone concerned by the breach should monitor card transactions closely, and immediately alert the financial institution involved about any unauthorized charges.

The Globe and Mail, citing an unnamed source, says as many as 60,000 people could be impacted.

Generate a summary:
input_text.Response A: Cloud computing is becoming more attractive to K-12 districts across the U.S. because of declining costs, a mature market, easy-access bandwidth and better security. Cloud storage services offer a range of benefits to districts, including on-demand support teams that can assist with any problems that arise.
input_text.Response B: Walmart Canada has taken down its online photo processing store following a potential breach of customer credit card data. The chain will be contacting customers who may be impacted, and recommends monitoring card transactions closely. The chain has suspended the photo website and all mobile applications pending an investigation. The breach may have affected up to 60,000 people.

input_meta.preamble_a: Respond using only short words and simple language, as if you were talking to a child.
input_meta.preamble_b: Respond using only short words and simple language, as if you were talking to a child.
